title.narrative: 2. INCREASING EQUITABLE AND INCLUSIVE ED

description.narrative: By 2022, technical departments have capacity to improve the provision of inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post- primary and informal education, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, including in emergency situations., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, communities have a greater demand for inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post-primary and informal education, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, and in particular in the Sahel and East regions including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, technical departments have capacity to improve the provision of inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post-primary and informal education, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, including inemergency situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF in Burkina Faso supported the Ministry of National Education, Literacy and Promotion of National Languages (MENAPLN) to increase the provision of access to education for all children. UNICEF in Burkina Faso supported the provision of quality education for approximately 76,066 children in 2021. UNICEF&39;s contribution to increasing supply-side access to education also took the form of extensive construction projects with 88 temporary or semi-finished classes built, and 136 finished classrooms made available to the MENAPLN;.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
